newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt bank to increase capital.
newsitem.headline: Egypt bank to increase capital.

text.p: Shareholders in Egypt's Housing and Development Bank on Sunday approved a proposal by the bank's board to increase paid-up capital by 24 million pounds ($7.07 million) to 78 million.
At an extraordinary meeting, the shareholders said the increase, which amounts to 2.4 million shares would be financed by a share offer.
Current shareholders would be able to buy 600,000 of the 2.4 million shares and 300,000 shares would go on offer to employees while the rest would be floated to the public.
It was not clear when the share offer would open or what the offer price would be.
At an annual general assembly also on Sunday, shareholders approved a dividend per share of two pounds for calender 1996, the bank's financial year, up from 1.5 per share in 1995.
